doc:
Maude Odell https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maude_Odell 0 Maude Odell (also spelled Maude O'Dell and sometimes known as Tillie Doremus or Maude Odell Doremus) (November 10, 1870 – February 27, 1937) was an American actress. She was one of the United States' best-known stage actresses of the early 20th century.Odell's first major success was The Prisoner of Zenda, in which she appeared for 400 nights in New York. She later performed in The Student Prince, Show Boat, and Tobacco Road. Her career spanned almost 40 years.Odell was found dead of a heart attack in her dressing room just before a performance of Tobacco Road. She was buried at the cemetery of St. Peter's Catholic Church in Beaufort, South Carolina. Maude_Odell ( also spelled Maude_O'Dell and sometimes_known as Tillie_Doremus or Maude_Odell_Doremus ) ( November_10_,_1870 – February_27_,_1937 ) was an_American_actress . She was one of the_United_States '_best-known_stage_actresses of the_early_20th_century.Odell 's_first_major_success was The_Prisoner of Zenda , in which she appeared for 400_nights in New_York . She later performed in The_Student_Prince , Show_Boat , and Tobacco_Road . Her_career spanned almost_40_years.Odell was_found dead of a_heart_attack in her_dressing_room just before a_performance of Tobacco_Road . She was_buried at the_cemetery of St._Peter 's_Catholic_Church in Beaufort , South_Carolina .
